page.title: 11Education in Staverton
page.content: In 1957 the number on roll at the Staverton School fell to 8 so the School next to the church was sold and is now a private dwelling.The children were taken to Landscove and the two schools joined.For the children up to the age of 11 there is quite a choice of schools ,however the L.E.A. will only provide transport for those within the catchment area. Some go to the Steiner Schooland other private schools ,some to larger local state schools such as Dartington but a majority attend Landscove. The 1980 Education Act and greater parent mobility has made this possible,but for country children each day still begins with the inevitable car or bus ride.Of 32 children at Landscove only 8 walk regularly ,and only 5 in all weathers. After 11 most children go to Totnes Comprehensive School by bus!
